description: Assesses ability to create suspense and control pacing in narrative

levels.4: Uses multiple suspense techniques (foreshadowing, cliffhangers, unanswered questions) effectively
levels.3: Uses at least one suspense technique that creates tension
levels.2: Attempts suspense but techniques are weak or underdeveloped
levels.1: No suspense techniques used; story feels flat

feedback_stems.strength: You built suspense effectively using techniques like
feedback_stems.growth: Try foreshadowing, cliffhangers, or unanswered questions to keep readers on the edge

levels.4: Pacing varies intentionally; slows for tension and speeds for action
levels.3: Some evidence of pacing control in key moments
levels.2: Pacing is mostly even; no intentional speeding up or slowing down
levels.1: Pacing is rushed throughout or drags consistently

feedback_stems.strength: Your pacing was skillful, especially when you slowed down at
feedback_stems.growth: Slow down at tense moments with more detail; speed up action scenes with shorter sentences

levels.4: Reader feels compelled to keep reading; genuine curiosity about what happens next
levels.3: Reader is engaged and wants to know the outcome
levels.2: Some interest but reader isn't fully hooked
levels.1: Reader loses interest; no sense of urgency

feedback_stems.strength: I had to keep reading to find out what happened because
feedback_stems.growth: Make readers wonder 'what happens next?' by withholding information at key moments
